Do you want to help change the world?
 
In 2008, Business Week named us one of the "Fifty Tech Startups You Should Know." More recently, we were selected as a Tech Pioneer by the World Economic Forum. Today, OPOWER, is an industry-leading energy efficiency and smart-grid software company.

The OPOWER team is made up of software engineers, product specialists, behavioral scientists, statisticians, direct marketing experts, and efficiency advocates. By the end of 2010, our energy savings will equal one-third of the power produced by the entire US solar industry – enough energy to power more than 150,000 homes.
 
About the Job

OPOWER is looking for smart, driven, and experienced engineers who are technically skilled, detail oriented, and desire to work on meaningful, large-scale energy efficiency software deployments .  Every energy utility company that utilizes OPOWER’s energy efficiency software receives a configured and deployed instance of OPOWER’s software application, and the Senior Professional Services Engineer plays the lead role in building, customizing, deploying, maintaining, and ultimately expanding the energy efficiency program for the utility.
 
We are looking for Senior Professional Services Engineers with significant experience and expertise across a broad base of technologies who are seeking a fast-paced, dynamic environment in which to utilize their arsenal of skills.   In addition to rapidly becoming experts at customizing and launching OPOWER’s energy efficiency software, Senior Professional Services Engineers are expected to use their skills and acquired institutional knowledge to design and build internal tools and processes with the aim of increasing the scalability, efficiency, and reliability of the customization and deployment process.  Additionally, OPOWER is growing rapidly and Senior Professional Services Engineers are expected to train and mentor less experienced Associate Professional Services Engineers.
 
Senior Professional Services Engineers rely on a diverse technical skillset, including, but not limited to: mastery of SQL and database management, significant experience on the Linux command line, experience with bash and/or perl scripting, and a high-level programming language such as Java.
 
The Senior Professional Services Engineer is a critical member of the team of OPOWER employees who deliver OPOWER’s SaaS-based energy efficiency programs on behalf of utility customers, including a Program Manager, an Associate Professional Services Engineer, as well as members of the software product and QA teams.  Strong verbal and written communication skills are a strict requirement of the Senior Professional Services Engineer.
